subject: Business
title: How Credit Scores Work
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on How Credit Scores Work.

hook.text: A three-digit number determines if you get a mortgage, what interest rate you pay, and sometimes if you get hired.

buildup.text: A credit score (300-850) represents your creditworthiness based on your borrowing and repayment history.

discovery.text: Five factors: payment history (35%), amounts owed (30%), length of history (15%), new credit (10%), credit mix (10%).

twist.text: Closing old credit cards hurts your score by reducing available credit and shortening your history.

climax.text: A 100-point difference can mean $50,000 more in mortgage interest over 30 years. The score has real cost.

punchline.text: Your credit score is your financial reputation in a single number.

quiz.question: What is the largest factor in a credit score?
